name: Ball Crunches
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back in a supine position with the exercise ball positioned under your lower back for support.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine to stabilize your body.

3. Lift both feet off the ground and bend at your hips, keeping your knees slightly bent and pointing upwards.

4. Slowly lower your upper body down towards the ground while keeping the ball stable under you, maintaining a tight core engagement.

5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, feeling the contraction in your abdominal muscles.

6. Push back up to the starting position using your abdominal muscles, ensuring controlled movements and avoiding jerks.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, taking care to maintain proper form and engage your core throughout.
short_summary: Ball crunches are a core exercises that primarily target the rectus abdominis muscle, but also engages other deep core muscles for stability.
